importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the update indicates the current status of the Trump-Putin summit discussions as of October 20, 2025.
The date corresponds to the most recent update on the status of the pre-summit meeting between Rubio and Lavrov being tabled.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame spans the period since Trump’s last in-person summit with Putin in Anchorage in early 2025, highlighting the ongoing diplomatic efforts.

keyTakeAways: President Donald Trump expressed hope for a quick summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin to end the war in Ukraine.
An anticipated pre-meeting between U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov was tabled due to divergent expectations on ending Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
Rubio and Lavrov previously discussed next steps after a call between Trump and Putin, but officials believe the Russian position remains maximalist and has not evolved sufficiently.
Trump has consistently advocated for an immediate end to the war, urging both Kyiv and Moscow to stop combat at the battle line.
The White House maintains that Trump is committed to peaceful diplomatic solutions and will work to achieve a durable resolution to the conflict.
The Kremlin described the Rubio-Lavrov call as constructive, but U.S. officials believe progress remains limited.

namedEntities.name: Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former President of the United States and current political figure who is actively pushing for a diplomatic resolution to the Ukraine war.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Trump is central to the article as the driving force behind the proposed Trump-Putin summit and has publicly called for an immediate end to the war in Ukraine.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Putin
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: President of Russia, the central figure in diplomatic discussions with U.S. officials regarding the war in Ukraine.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Putin is the counterpart to Trump in the proposed summit and is the key Russian leader whose position on Ukraine is being evaluated in diplomatic talks.

namedEntities.name: Marco Rubio
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: U.S. Secretary of State, involved in pre-summit diplomatic coordination with Russian officials.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Rubio is a key U.S. foreign policy advisor whose views on ending the war are influencing whether the Trump-Putin summit proceeds.

namedEntities.name: Sergey Lavrov
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Russian Foreign Minister, counterpart to Marco Rubio in diplomatic discussions.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Lavrov represents Russia's official position on Ukraine and is directly involved in negotiations that may or may not lead to a summit between Trump and Putin.

namedEntities.name: Hungary
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Country where the proposed Trump-Putin summit was scheduled to take place.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The summit was initially planned to occur in Budapest, Hungary, indicating the location of the high-level diplomatic engagement between the U.S. and Russia.

namedEntities.name: Anchorage, Alaska
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Location of the last in-person summit between Trump and Putin.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The prior summit in Anchorage, held over two months ago, set the context for current diplomatic efforts and serves as a reference point for the timeline of U.S.-Russia relations.

namedEntities.name: Ukraine
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Country currently under military conflict with Russia, central to the diplomatic discussion.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The war in Ukraine is the core issue driving the diplomatic efforts between Trump and Putin, with both leaders seeking a peaceful resolution.

summaryOfNewsArticle: President Donald Trump has expressed hopes for a swift summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin to end the ongoing invasion of Ukraine, but that effort may be delayed after a scheduled pre-meeting between U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov was postponed due to disagreements over the feasibility of ending the war. Although both leaders previously agreed on the need for dialogue, officials note that Russia has not made significant changes to its maximalist stance, leading to a lack of progress in the diplomatic coordination. The White House emphasizes Trump’s commitment to peace and diplomatic solutions, while the Kremlin views the recent calls as constructive. As of now, the Trump-Putin summit in Budapest, Hungary, remains under discussion, but the absence of a clear path forward in pre-summit talks may stall the process.
title: Trump’s hope for quick second summit with Putin may be stalled as pre-meeting tabled for now
